key_points: President Donald Trump plans to leave the White House for Florida before President-elect Joe Biden's inauguration.
Trump will hold a farewell ceremony at Joint Base Andrews with possible features like a color guard and 21-gun salute.
Trump's decision to skip Biden's inauguration breaks over a century of tradition.
Vice President Mike Pence is set to attend Biden's inauguration, despite Trump's absence.
Pence called Vice President-elect Kamala Harris to offer congratulations and assistance.
Biden dismissed Trump's decision not to attend as one of the few agreements between them.
Trump and Pence's relationship has deteriorated, especially after Pence's role in counting electoral votes.
An angry mob, incited by Trump, stormed the U.S. Capitol, chanting "Hang Pence".
Trump has been impeached twice, with the second impeachment related to his actions before the Capitol assault.
Trump will be the first president since 1869 to skip his successor's inauguration.
